items.title: The Chatter: Closing the Year Without Closure
items.summary: - TCIL: 10–12% rev growth from multimodal transport; faster back-end for quick commerce; capex ~₹1,000cr in 3–4 yrs; two ships; funded by internal accruals; macro headwinds. - HUDCO: AUM to ~₹1.5–1.6 lakh cr by 2026 with ~₹50k cr disbursement; PMAY-2 not a hard target; NPA 0.07% in Q2; RBI cuts to ease funding. - TechEra/Anupam Rasayan/Jayhawk: tooling MOUs and CDMO push; TCS AI growth and high client AI adoption; aerospace/defense demand tailwinds.

items.title: Points & Figures: The Hint in the Haze
items.summary:
- Signals behind the numbers from 13 Indian companies across 9 industries, incl. Varvee Global, Chandni Textiles, Candour Techtex, Bigbloc, and TCS.
- AAC wall panels enable faster, insulated construction; plastics/packaging demand and Make in India subsidies drive growth.
- TCS AI growth (~$11B revenue; ~38% YoY) with broad ecosystem; other names like Srigee DLM, Anya Polytech, Lead Reclaim, Vigor Plast, Polyplex; Reddit markets discussion invite.

items.title: The Chatter: The Pivot Quarter
items.summary:
- Capex revival across energy, infra, and manufacturing; hydrogen, commercial AC, solar, and localization themes gain pace with PLI support.
- Education-tech outlook firm: PhysicsWallah offline expansion, PW Academy reaching thousands of schools, and AI upskilling initiatives.
- Policy shifts drive near-term OEM demand (GST cuts) while geopolitics and reforms influence export and capex trajectories.

items.title: Points & Figures: Cues in the Clutter
items.summary:
- Distills investor decks across 14 Indian companies and 9 industries, flagging Tata Power's capex, 500 GW non-fossil target by 2030, and renewables-led growth.
- Covers multiple names (Jayant Infratech, Fujiyama, Swastika, Frog Cellsat, FIL, ABS Marine, Coforge, Excelsoft, Uflex, Sacheerome, BioconEnergy) with growth levers in electrification, IoT, telecom and IT services.
- Highlights DAS, OHE, rooftop solar, edtech, packaging and biosimilars as long-term growth avenues, with Biocon's improving leverage and biosimilars focus.

items.title: The Chatter: Playing the Long Game
items.summary:
- Overview of Indian markets and infrastructure players (CDSL/NSDL), market shares, onboarding pace, and recurring vs non-recurring revenue themes.
- Highlights on Studds-Decathlon, RACL Geartech, Emerald Tyre, CGS, and other firms with growth trajectories, margins, and cross-border expansion plans.
- The Chatter aims to reveal the gap between narrative and numbers, stressing investor takeaways on risk, valuation, and long-term opportunities across sectors.

items.title: Points & Figures: Clarity Beneath the Complexity
items.summary:
- Analyzes 17 Indian corporate decks across 7 sectors, highlighting signals behind the numbers and key names (Groww, BHFL, Tata Capital, Websol).
- Themes: financial services, solar manufacturing (ALMM/PLI), infra and auto components with a China+1 tilt.
- Macro backdrop: stable liquidity and normalized rates, rising logistics/EV value chains, with risks from freight, FX, geopolitics, and policy shifts.

items.title: The Chatter: A Quarter That Refuses To Behave
Points & Figures: The pulse beneath the pixels
items.summary:
- Points & Figures distills investor decks and reports to reveal signals behind the numbers, covering 14 Indian firms across 9 sectors with highlights on Studds Accessories, Wardwizard/Joy e-bike, Autoline, and CESC.
- India’s power/regulatory shift includes tariff recovery curbs, discom privatization, Electricity Bill 2025, and renewables rising to 44%+ by 2032; data-centre, network gear, and green capacity expansion.
- Emmvee’s TOPCon/Mono PERC modules (ALMM-listed) and other sectors (packaging, insurance, Yes Bank, jewellery); readers invited to comment on Reddit (r/marketsbyzerodha) with AI-curation notes.

items.title: The Chatter: Bottlenecks & Breakouts
items.summary:
- Guinea bauxite logistics upgrades boost Q2 FY26 exports to 1.33 Mt (2x) as 2026 long-term deals de-risk barging/transhipment.  
- BASF dynamics, India-specific moves, and Titagarh Wagons expansion point to better run rates in shipbuilding/EPC amid overcapacity pressure.  
- India-focused ramp-up: in-house aluminium coaches, wheel-set fixes, Allcargo merger, and tenders with price-variation clauses shaping near-term visibility.

items.title: Points & Figures: Where Data meets Direction
items.summary: - Analyzes investor presentations to extract signals behind the numbers across 14 Indian companies in 9 sectors, focusing on growth plans, margins, new markets and risks.\n- Highlights sector dynamics: diagnostics expansion (Dr. Lal PathLabs), ARV/biosimilars growth (Emcure), VFX momentum (Phantom) and formalization in the hand-tools market (De Neers).\n- Notes macro drivers—GST, demonetization, infra spend—and opportunities in infra, renewables, and downstream products to support long‑term value.
